pageContext.claim: “I'm giving, as you probably have heard, $16 billion to the farmers of our country. That's the amount that China took back. And I'm doing that out of tariffs, because we've taken in many billions more than that.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a stretch. The $16 billion in aid was aimed at offsetting the losses farmers are suffering due to Trump’s trade policies. The bailouts exceed the amount of money the United States has earned from the tariffs -- which are not paid by China but by U.S. importers and consumers.
